title: Prosecutors: Peterson Sought Bachelor Life
content: With just a day to summarize their case against Scott Peterson, prosecutors painted a picture of a man so desperate for freedom from domestic drudgery that he turned to murder as his only way out.

title: Dell to recall 4.1M laptop batteries
content: Dell Inc. said Monday it will recall 4.1 million notebook computer batteries because they can overheat and catch fire. Dell negotiated conditions of the recall with the federal Consumer Product Safety Commission, which called it the largest electronics-related recall ever conducted by the agency.

content: Wendy Alexander dismisses fresh calls for her to resign over donations to her leadership campaign.

title: Advertising's lucrative new frontier
content: Mobile advertising looks set to be one of the most discussed topics at this week's Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, but the challenge for the telecoms industry this year will be to prove it is more than just hype.

title: Goldfields sues Harmony

title: McMorris ousted by Rockies

title: Freddie Mac net profit tumbles as defaults rise

title: Market Place: Genzyme to Make Offer for AnorMed

content: Yukos has paid three-quarters of its total tax debt of $3.4bn (Â£1.91bn; 99bn roubles) for 2000, the Interfax news agency has reported.

title: Africa backs French troops in Ivory Coast

title: Paper: Taser to Increase Stun Gun's Power
content: Taser International Inc. has warned  police departments that its newest electric stun gun recently  failed to subdue some suspects, and it will increase the power  of the weapon, The New York Times reported on Friday.

title: Eight-year ban for Collins
content: The United States Anti-Doping Agency last night banned the sprinter Michelle Collins for eight years, even though she has never tested positive for drugs, in a case which could have serious repercussions for Marion Jones.

title: Water-boarding 'would be torture'
content: US national intelligence chief Mike McConnell says water-boarding "would be torture" if he was subjected to it.

title: Sex Pistols to play L.A. club show in October
content: Reunited punk rock icons the Sex  Pistols will warm up for their English tour with a private club  show in Los Angeles on October 25, a gig that will mark their  first public performance in four years.

title: NO QUIT IN HOLYFIELD
content: Why is he still doing this? Why would a man who has millions in the bank, who has won the undisputed world heavyweight title four times, climb back into the ring at the age of 42?

title: Japan: Activity around North Korean site

content: International sanctions alone will not prevent Iran making enough high-grade uranium for a nuclear bomb, according to an internal European Union study leaked on Tuesday.

title: No new commitments for NATO Afghan force

title: Sixth Hole At Utah Mine Yields No New Hope
content: HUNTINGTON, Utah, Aug. 25 -- The latest hole drilled into a collapsed mine where six men are trapped broke through into a chamber where there is not enough space for the men to survive, a lawyer for several of the men's families said Saturday.

title: Fall a Fake, Jail Time for Real

title: Connolly sews up Buffalo's victory

title: As cellphone uses grow, so do security options
content: SAN FRANCISCO - Banks and credit card agencies are gearing up security for financial transactions over cellphones and other handheld devices. Aware that a growing number of consumers - especially those under 35 - are comfortable using cellphones as digital wallets, leading financial institutions are concocting mobile-security options to protect them from hackers and cyberthieves.

title: 'Lucky' Blake nets hat trick; Isles win

title: Hurricane Center's Director Under Attack
